name: ebulliently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an energetic, positive, and happy way: She had been talking ebulliently about playing at the Australian Open. The book has an ebulliently vulgar feel. See
ebullient
More examplesFewer examplesHe stood at the center of it all, ebulliently chatting with a classmate.Harvie's essay is quietly persuasive and ebulliently entertaining."Red Planet" is an excellent new series, ebulliently presented by Heather Couper.
